item.title: Report X-2024060509
item.description:
Report X-2024060509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat shipped fully regulated. 1oz lost from two of four 2.5L plastic bottles of Diversey Glance HC (sku 905779) due to loose cap closures. PLEASE NOTE: Four bottles were placed 2x2 in two UNPOP Y rated fiberboard boxes bundled together with tape; this package may have been erroneously processed with a 96 by origin station, which is why Unprocessed was selected. OVH scan at NASH.

item.title: Report X-2024060890
item.description:
Report X-2024060890

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a Fedex envelope was found smoking on a slide. A spill agent was called the smoke stopped before the agent arrived. While investigating the shipment the agent discovered two sealed lead acid batteries non-spillable inside. The batteries were packed in fiberboard boxes in the envelope. One of the batteries had burn marks inside of the fiberboard box. The package didn't have any DG markings, paperwork attached also there was no shipping label on the outer packaging. The shipment is being held at the MEMH location.

item.title: Report X-2024060780
item.description:
Report X-2024060780

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A metal drum was dropped during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The drum was dented and the bottom chime was damaged causing a release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024060779
item.description:
Report X-2024060779

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found crushed in a drive lane outside of the MEMH dangerous goods building. The contents of the fiberboard box was a single glass bottle which was broken spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024060891
item.description:
Report X-2024060891

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained three metal jerrycans of UN1866. The shipment didn't have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.
